Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
With just over 8 years of experience in the Portuguese market, we share our DNA with more than 200 workers and position our offer according to 3 lines of service:

  • Strategy (Outsourcing, NeXel, Team as a Service, Tech Academies);
  • R&D (Bootcamps, POC, Tech Lab);
  • Nearshore.


In ADENTIS, we focus on PEOPLE. This is our emotional salary:

  • Great Work-Life balance;
  • Very flexible organizational routine;
  • Health benefits (for you and your family);
  • Team Building activities;
  • Over 300 protocols to offer you great discounts in different areas;
  • Continuous professional development sponsored by our Training and Certification Department;
  • Regular feedback on your performance through a personalized plan;
  • Comprehensive career plan and progression involving assertive performance reviews.


Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate and interact regularly with diverse stakeholders and other data teams across Siemens as a consultant and enabler.
  • Implement and develop solutions for business uses cases applying AI/ML techniques and frameworks, including LLM models
  • Ensure security and privacy compliance with data standards for data handling and model deployment.

You must have:

  • Knowledge and understanding of ML models, including LLM
  • Experience working with Databases (relation and non-relational), Data Structures (json, xml) and using SQL
  • Programming experience in Python and any Data Science & ML packages, such as: numpy, pandas, matplotlib, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, nltk, spacy, gensim;
  • Experience communicating and dealing with different stakeholders
  • Familiarity with agile methodologies, such as SCRUM
  • European Union Citizenship or Portuguese Working Visa / Portuguese Residency.
  • Availability to go to the office, twice a week in Lisbon

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Richemont owns some of the world‚Äôs leading luxury goods Maisons, with strengths in jewellery, fine watches & premium accessories, including Cartier, Van Cleef & Arpels, Montblanc, Vacheron Constantin, etc.

We are seeking for a talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic Data Science & AI team within the Group Data Office.

You‚Äôll be part of the team that is responsible for integrating artificial intelligence across our group, and you'll be directly involved in developing AI-powered solutions that are already impacting thousands of users daily.

If you're passionate about working in a fast-paced, innovative cloud environment and eager to make a real impact on the world of luxury, we encourage you to apply.

You Will Be Responsible For


Designing & developing complex ML&AI-driven approaches to solve business problems , including natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, time series analysis, recommendation systems, etc.
Leveraging Generative AI to build innovative multimodal RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) systems and Agentic AI solutions.
Gathering requirements and effectively communicating developed solution to the business.
Exploring new AI techniques and technologies to drive innovation across Richemont.
Partnering with Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Analytics Engineers & IT to deliver solutions.


If You Have


Master's or PhD degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related Engineering discipline.
2+ years of experience in Data Science & Machine Learning, with a proven track record of developing and deploying machine learning models.
2+ years of professional experience in Python programming language and data-related libraries.
Professional experience in Google Cloud Platform or other cloud platforms, including experience with cloud-based machine learning services.
Autonomy, proactive & curious with a strong sense of ownership.
English mandatory.
Bonus if you‚Äôre experienced in Google Vertex AI and Git.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!




Our mission is to be a meaningful part of our people‚Äôs careers. As we grow, so does our determination to offer the best experience to our employees and clients ‚Äî and that‚Äôs exactly what drives us.

We are a Portuguese tech consulting company with offices in Lisbon, Porto and √ìbidos, and representations in Brazil and Tunisia. With over 12 years of market expertise, we‚Äôre now a universe of around 400 people working on-site, remotely or in hybrid mode on projects across 20+ countries.

We believe that great people build successful companies ‚Äî that‚Äôs why we are committed to valuing, recognising and fostering the growth of our professionals.

We don‚Äôt want to be just another line on your CV. We want you to live a Lifetime Experience with us. That‚Äôs why we invest in training and certifications that reflect your real progression, promote a healthy work-life balance and offer benefits that impact your personal life and your career.




#welcometoyourfuture




What we‚Äôre looking for:




3+ years of hands-on experience in machine learning and AI development.
Strong expertise in Generative AI (model training, fine-tuning, and deployment).
Experience with open-source and commercial LLMs.
Advanced programming skills in Python.
Deep understanding of NLP techniques and architectures.
Practical experience with traditional AI/ML methods
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) for AI/ML deployments.
Fluency in English is mandatory.




Being Affinity

#Affinity ‚Äì Build genuine and empathetic relationships with colleagues, clients and candidates (not just with tech, languages and platforms). Be a team player and bring good vibes;

#Ambition ‚Äì Strive to do more and better. Aim to exceed expectations and grow both personally and professionally;

#Action ‚Äì Bring the energy to make things happen. Show initiative and drive;

#Learning ‚Äì Be eager to evolve, individually and as a team, and become an expert in the tech market;

#Assertiveness ‚Äì Communicate honestly and transparently, always with constructive feedback.




Your #LifetimeExperience

¬∑ Take part in national and international projects in a company built on personal relationships, simplicity and efficiency, with a disruptive presence in the tech market;

¬∑ Access a personalised career and training plan, directly linked to your performance and motivation;

¬∑ Be part of a welcoming, trusting, respectful and informal environment;

¬∑ Join our Affinity Communities (sports, tech, hobbies, etc.) and actively participate in social and environmental responsibility initiatives;

¬∑ Enjoy a wide range of benefits, partnerships, discounts, events and internal initiatives.




Beyond your professional satisfaction, we want to offer you memorable moments of fun and connection ‚Äî worthy of an Affinity experience.

Join the Experience!

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Analytics & AI

Hala is a social enterprise working to transform the nature of protection and accountability in the world's toughest places by democratizing advanced defense, sensing, and artificial intelligence technology. Hala is currently saving lives, reducing trauma, and improving resilience for millions of people.

Our team works across the globe and hails from over 15 countries. We speak more than 20 languages and have studied and worked in leading educational, business, research, and government institutions. We are mission-driven thinkers, and we share a deep respect for each other and for the communities that partner with us.

We believe in innovation with purpose, focusing on developing real and applicable technology solutions to the challenges facing the planet. We believe in working ethically and collaboratively and making decisions with transparency. We value flexibility, adaptability, and a good sense of humor.

Role Overview:

The AI Engineer is a key member of the Analytics & AI team, focusing on implementing cutting-edge AI systems and agentic patterns that enable impactful, autonomous, and adaptive solutions. They will design, develop, and integrate innovative frameworks leveraging AI to address real-world challenges, prioritizing the creation of systems that drive meaningful and positive change. While technical expertise is essential, the primary expectation is a passion for building impactful solutions and a commitment to driving forward-thinking applications of AI in dynamic environments. This role emphasizes implementation and integration over model training, allowing for versatility across evolving technological landscapes.

This is a full-time position. The role can be based in Europe (Lisbon, Berlin, or other locations), with a flexible hybrid remote working policy, with a salary range of ‚Ç¨100,000 to ‚Ç¨110,000

We‚Äôll trust you to:


Design and implement robust, agentic AI systems and reusable workflows that enable autonomous decision-making capabilities, leveraging agentic frameworks. Ensure solutions are optimized for scalability, adaptability, and reliability across diverse environments, including on-premise and cloud-based systems.
Build and maintain robust data engineering pipelines to support system evaluation and foundational model training, ensuring data quality, scalability, and efficiency in processing large and complex datasets.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists and ML engineers, to align AI workflows with product requirements and real-world applications.
Develop and maintain systems that facilitate seamless integration of AI models into broader pipelines, with a focus on agentic and multi-modal use cases.
Actively engage in Agile product development processes, contributing to sprints, stand-ups, and collaborative planning sessions.
Stay informed about advancements in the AI landscape and proactively demonstrate new approaches, ensuring the team remains at the forefront of innovation.
Drive iterative improvements to systems, products, and processes in a collaborative environment, contributing to the quarterly OKR process and broader organizational goals.
Provide mentorship, foster collaboration, and invest in personal and team-wide learning to cultivate a culture of continuous growth and impactful innovation.


We‚Äôd love to see the following:


Master‚Äôs or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or equivalent professional experience demonstrating exceptional capability is equally valued.
Experience implementing agentic frameworks and patterns, such as LangChain /LangGraph, and integrating large language models (LLMs) into complex systems.
Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with data processing and workflow frameworks such as Kedro, Pandas, Dask, or equivalents. Adaptability to new tools and frameworks is a plus.
Proven experience applying AI or ML models to solve real-world problems, with a focus on system-level integration rather than solely model training.
Familiarity with multi-modal AI systems and applications of vision-language models or LLMs in tasks requiring multi-modal understanding.
Demonstrated ability to design scalable and maintainable data engineering pipelines to support AI system evaluation and model training.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with a proven ability to articulate complex concepts to diverse audiences.
Previous experience with Agile product development processes and a track record of contributing to collaborative team environments.
A strong passion for creating impactful systems and driving innovation with the potential to generate positive change in the world.


What Hala offers you:


Life-saving social impact.
Competitive salaries.
Flexible Time-Off so you can take time off when needed.
Comprehensive, worldwide healthcare, dental, and vision insurance for you and your family at no cost.
Paid parental leave.
Flexible working policy, including the ability to work from home.
A diverse, international community of dedicated, hardworking team players committed to interdisciplinary collaboration and thriving workplace culture.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
PrimeIT is a leading company with over 17 years of experience in providing IT, Telecommunications, and Engineering technological services.




Specialized in Team Extension, Managed Services, Custom Software, and Nearshore, we currently have a team of over 2350 professionals collaborating on national and international projects across various technologies.




We are looking for a Data Scientist for this project!




What are we looking for?

Strong knowledge of programming, algorithms and data structures and industrial experience in languages such as Python and SQL variations(Hive, Impala, PostgreSQL).
Knowledge of Data Science techniques with evidence of using them on data across supervised & unsupervised learning business problems. Technical understanding of most commonly used algorithms - Linear Regressions, Random Forests, SVMs, KNN, K-means, etc.
Experience of working on models that are productionalised and created tracable business impact is a huge plus.
Strong proficiency in the following libraries: numpy, spicy, pandas, scikit learn, matplotlib, seatborn. Profficiency in PySpark, data engineering, Kedro framework is a huge plus.




What do we offer?

Integration into an international company with a presence in over 50 cities worldwide;
Continuous training in the latest and most innovative technologies ‚Äì Prime Academy;
Career guidance and progression.




üì© Send us your CV and join the Prime team!

Title: Associate Data Scientist
Description:
We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We‚Äôve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.



Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.





Job Description



As a Data Scientist at Unit4, you will design, develop, deploy, and maintain machine learning models that drive innovation and efficiency in our software solutions. You will work closely with data engineers, machine learning engineers, software developers, and product managers to ensure our models are scalable, robust, ethically designed, and aligned with business goals.





Qualifications



Key Responsibilities:



Collaborate with software engineers and product managers, to support the design and integration of responsible ML solutions into company products.
Design, develop, deploy, and maintain machine learning models to solve diverse business challenges.
Use and set requirements of ML workflows for continuous integration and deployment.
Ensure reproducibility, performance, reliability, scalability, and security of ML models in production.
Implement responsible AI principles to ensure fairness, accountability, and transparency in AI solutions.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in machine learning.



Requirements:



Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or a related field.
Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, AI, or a related field is desirable.
Strong understanding and experience in Machine Learning.
Proficiency in Python and experience with ML frameworks.
Familiarity with MLOps.
Familiarity with foundational concepts and frameworks in LLMs and autonomous agents is a plus.
Experience with Azure, ML lifecycle management tools (Azure Machine Learning Studio, MLflow, Databricks, etc.), and containerization tools (Kubernetes, Docker) is a plus.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work in an agile and fast-paced development environment.


Additional Information



Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We‚Äôre a fast-paced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience, and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities. Grow with us At Unit4, we offer:

‚Ä¢ a culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful;

‚Ä¢ balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being;

‚Ä¢ talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry;

‚Ä¢ a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet;

‚Ä¢ a safe and inclusive working environment ‚Äì supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.



This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though ‚Äì we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!

Title: Data Scientist (f/m/div.)
Description:
The Bosch group has more than 400 000 employees around the world, present in 60 countries, and we are proud to impact people‚Äôs lives and to work towards a more sustainable future.



Bosch Service Solutions in Lisbon develops and offers Customer Experience, Mobility, and Monitoring solutions for its clients, and plays a prominent role in providing Engineering and Software Development services in the technology market. Every day, our teams find fast, efficient, and innovative solutions for thousands of people.



At Bosch, we shape the future by inventing high-quality technologies and services that spark enthusiasm and enrich people‚Äôs lives. Our promise to our associates is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and we inspire each other. Join in and feel the difference in mindsets, cultures, generations, identities and perspectives. Everyone should bring their authenticity and work together respectfully. Bosch is an employer that values diversity and equal opportunities. We welcome applications from people with disabilities and we can provide reasonable accommodations during the recruitment process and in the performance of professional activity. By including everyone and ensuring equal opportunities we unleash our full potential.





Job Description



As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for applying AI and machine learning techniques to create solutions that bring impact to the organization. In this role, you will be developing and deploying AI solutions, ensuring their performance and reliability through ongoing monitoring, and promoting data-driven decision-making within the organization.



Your contribution to something big:



AI solution ideation and development
Identifying business problems and solving them by finding data and methods, resulting in measurable business improvements (KPI tracking);
Utilizing mathematical, econometric, statistical and deep learning models to develop predictive models for solving business relevant problems;
Developing, deploying, and monitoring GenAI-based applications, including experience with Agentic Frameworks (e.g., LangGraph, LlamaIndex, CrewAI, or similar) and including the implementation of MLOps/LLMOps best practices.
Communication and enabling
Effectively communicating with various departments and roles about data-driven business decisions;
Acting as a facilitator for the introduction and adoption of new AI and ML-based technologies;
Supporting communication and awareness initiatives for different stakeholders at Electrified Motion (EM) divisional level to foster digital enablement and bridge digital skill gaps.


Qualifications



What distinguishes you:



Education:



Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, or related fields.

Experience:



At least 2 years of relevant work experience in AI, machine learning, or data science roles;
Experience managing software or IT projects;
Experience with predictive modeling using mathematical, statistical, econometric, and deep learning techniques.

Know-how



Proficiency in Python programming and algorithm development/implementation;
Knowledge of cloud infrastructure, preferably Azure, Databricks and MLOps/LLMOps.

Languages



Proficient in English (written and spoken).

Working Style and Personality



Strong communication skills to effectively engage with diverse teams and stakeholders;
Ability to facilitate knowledge sharing and digital skill enablement across business units;
Passionate about innovation and continuous learning.


Additional Information

üåê Exchange with colleagues around the world

Title: AI Engineer (m/f) - Hybrid (Lisbon)
HTML:
Descri√ß√£o da Empresa

Somos uma Consultora com compet√™ncias multidisciplinares dotada de um portf√≥lio que abrange diversas √°reas, como Financeira, Telecomunica√ß√µes, Autom√≥vel. Desenvolvemos Produtos e Projectos. Estamos presentes em empresas de refer√™ncia Nacionais e Internacionais. A nossa combina√ß√£o √∫nica de solu√ß√µes tecnol√≥gicas, metodologias e os nossos recursos humanos qualificam a entrega aos nossos clientes.

Descri√ß√£o da Fun√ß√£o

Match Profiler is an Information Systems consultancy with over 25 years of experience in the national and international technology market. We believe in challenging and motivating projects, driven by multidisciplinary and agile teams - and we are looking for those who want to grow with us. With a close-knit approach, we develop solutions that drive business growth with innovation, trust and security. If you aspire to a career that challenges you daily and allows you to make a real impact - this opportunity is for you. We are currently strengthening the team of one of our clients with the following profile: AI Engineer (m/f) - Hybrid (Lisbon) What we are looking for: Hard skills:

  • Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, data science, artificial intelligence, Mathematics or a related field;
  • Proven experience working as an AI Engineer, machine learning engineer, or similar role;
  • Solid understanding of LLMs, machine learning and deep learning techniques, algorithms, and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, LangChain);
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and Java, and experience with relevant libraries and tools for data manipulation, analysis, and visualization (e.g., NumPy, pandas, Matplotlib);
  • Experience with big data processing and distributed computing frameworks (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus;
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their AI services;
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions;
  • A self-driven and proactive attitude, with a passion for learning and staying updated on emerging technologies and industry trends;
  • Provide technical guidance and support to junior AI engineers, fostering knowledge sharing and continuous learning within the team. Soft skills:
  • Good communication
  • Team spirit
  • Proactivity
  • Time management What we have to offer:
  • Careful onboarding and close support from day one.
  • Continuous feedback aligned with your professional goals.
  • An accessible and collaborative team ready to support each individual's journey.
  • A close-knit environment where idea sharing and personal development are valued.
  • Access to a network of partnerships offering exclusive discounts on health, wellness, travel, culture, gastronomy, leisure and much more.
  • Social events and initiatives that strengthen team spirit. Localiza√ß√£o
  • Lisboa, Portugal

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.

Create and enhance projects in Java, Python, Angular, PHP, .NET and so much more while diving in the world of Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Security and Internet of Things.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

As a data scientist, you will be responsible for leading the design of solutions and managing the teams that develop them within a project. You will also be responsible for selecting a team with the appropriate skillset or ensuring that the team acquires the required capabilities in due time. You must also ensure proper solution delivery, monitoring, and governance using MLOps.

As a part of your job, you will:

  • Leverage data and domain knowledge to solve business problems and create quantifiable value;
  • Work cross-functionally to define problem statements, collect data, build analytical models, and design suitable solutions;
  • Build and maintain (or lead the development of) data-driven optimization models, experiments, forecasting algorithms, and capacity constraint models;
  • Lead teams into delivering models using best MLOps practices;
  • Communicate final recommendations and support decision-making.


What are we looking for?

  • Degree in an analytical field (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Management Science);
  • Scripting with Python and nice to have one of these languages (e.g., Pyspark, Spark-mllib);
  • Experienced with packages such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, matplotlib, and tensorflow/pytorch;
  • Minimum 2Y of project experience as a Data Scientist;
  • Professional experience with Java, Scala, or Spark;
  • Experience working with and leading teams in a project environment;
  • Experience in delivering projects using MLOps best practices.


Personal traits

  • Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams, and Clients;
  • Teamwork skills but also a sense of autonomy;
  • Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included;
  • Willingness to collaborate with other players;
  • Strong communication skills.


At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.

As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.

Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.

Title: AI Engineer
HTML:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to deliver value through knowledge. We enable companies to meet the challenges of the digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.


DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:


  • DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;


  • DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;


  • DECSKILL CONNECT through which we provide our clients with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.


Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technological solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.


We are looking for a AI Engineer, a hybrid position based in Lisbon.


Requirements:

  • Experience developing in Python Development (minimum 3 years);
  • Proven experience as AI Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer or similar role;
  • Experience using Java, LLMs and LangChain;
  • Experience using TensorFlow, Pytorch and Keras;
  • Experience using Cloud Platforms (e.g AWS, Azure or GCP);
  • Good English (min B2).


If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV in English to diogo.sousa@decskill.com with reference DS/AIE.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Python Developer

Seniority: Mid-s√©nior




The amazing you, will have:

Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or similar;
Minimum 3 years of professional experience as a python Developer;
Solid knowledge of Python, Flask, FastAPI, Sphinx, Helm, GitHub, Azure cloud resources, Docker
Fluency in the English language (mandatory) and portuguese;
Hybrid in Lisbon - 2x week at the office




Why should you become part of our family?

Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity

In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you

Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. At KCS IT, we stand for equality and value diversity. We foster a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit.

All applications with the required skills for the position are welcome!

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What you will do


Support data-driven decision-making by preparing and analyzing data related to customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales across multiple channels.
Work closely with data scientists and business stakeholders to translate business questions into meaningful insights.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support data science model development.
Use Python and SQL to clean, process, and visualize data in support of analytics and modeling projects.
Apply basic statistical methods (e.g. descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, hypothesis testing) to uncover insights.
Ensure data quality and consistency across sources by collaborating with data engineering and IT teams.
Communicate findings clearly through presentations and storytelling.
Actively participate in sprint planning, reviews, and agile ceremonies within the team.



What you‚Äôll bring


1‚Äì2 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or a related data role (internships included).
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or Engineering.
Experience working with data using SQL and Python (pandas, matplotlib/seaborn).
Experience with PySpark and Spark technologies is a strong plus, but not mandatory.
Basic understanding of statistics and its application in business analytics.
Strong attention to detail, curiosity, and eagerness to learn.
Good communication skills, including the ability to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Team player with a proactive mindset and willingness to grow in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English (written and spoken)



Nice to have:


Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or Databricks.
Knowledge of Python packages used in machine learning (e.g. scikit-learn).
Participation in academic or personal analytics projects



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our team in Porto. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis, machine learning, and Python development to deliver insights that drive smarter business decisions and innovative solutions.




Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deploy data-driven models and machine learning solutions.
Perform data exploration, cleaning, and feature engineering to support predictive and analytical models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, product, business) to define data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
Develop scalable data pipelines and contribute to the improvement of existing data infrastructure.
Visualize and communicate complex data findings in a clear and compelling way.
Apply best practices in model validation, testing, and monitoring.




Requirements

5+ years of experience in Data Science or a related field.
Strong proficiency in Python and its data ecosystem (Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, etc.).
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Matplotlib, Plotly, Power BI, or similar).
Solid understanding of statistical methods, machine learning techniques, and model evaluation.
Familiarity with SQL and data management.
Ability to work in a hybrid model (1x per week on-site in Porto).
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate data insights into business recommendations.




Nice to Have

Experience with deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
Familiarity with MLOps practices and deployment of models into production.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist (Hybrid @Porto)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Scientist

Seniority: 5+

Type of position: Hybrid (at Porto Office)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
4-5+ years of professional experience in DATA SCIENCE.
Proficiency in Python and data manipulation libraries such as Pandas/Numpy.
Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques.
Experience with SQL and database management.
ML knowledge, and Dataiku like technologies (Isoft Stat Mining, MLE) are a plus.
Power BI experience.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English is mandatory.




To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

French AND/OR Portuguese fluency.







Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefer the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psychologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!




Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Innovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: AI Engineer - 100% Remote
Description:
Its not magic. Its artificial intelligence. And you could be the next wizard.

You know that moment when everything clicks and you realize youre ready for something bigger? This is that moment.

Position: AI Engineer (100% remote in Portugal)

So, what does it mean to be an AI Engineer here?

It means being at the forefront of innovation, turning real-world challenges into smart solutions. It means working with deep learning, NLP, computer vision, chatbots, and agentic AI platforms to reinvent how our clients operate.

What youll be doing (in epic fashion):


Develop AI solutions that actually work not just in theory, but in the real world.
Work with deep learning, NLP, TensorFlow, computer vision, chatbots, and agentic platforms.
Take part in multidisciplinary projects, from functional design to prototyping and testing.
Document solutions, share learnings, and contribute to our AI strategy.
Collaborate with internal teams to identify innovation opportunities using AI.



What you bring to the table:

Mandatory:


Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience in AI solutions.
Strong command of Machine Learning, Deep Learning, TensorFlow, NLP, and related areas.
Solid understanding of algorithms, object-oriented design, and functional principles.
Experience in developing REST APIs, and designing NoSQL and relational databases.
English fluency is mandatory.



Valued:


Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Experience with innovation accelerators.
Familiarity with cloud environments.



Why work with us:


Challenging projects with direct impact on our clients.
A collaborative, curious team with a spirit of innovation.
Hybrid and flexible work environment.
Competitive salary and benefits tailored to your needs.
Real opportunities for growth and development.



Were not looking for someone perfect. Were looking for someone real.

If youre an AI Engineer ready to be part of something thats changing the game, we want to talk to you.

Apply now and join the digital revolution.

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Linde Portugal, LDA

Data Scientist (m/f/d)

Porto or Lisboa, Portugal, Barcelona, Spain | req22905

What You Will Enjoy Doing


You will generate value out of data by identification, driving and implementing use cases in the area of analytics across all value streams/ regions/functions
Furthermore, you will provide profound business understanding combined with a strong skillset of advanced data engineering and data science to transform business questions into data driven insight in language such as SQL, R, Python etc
Together with the data science lead drive the concept of data insights and advanced analytics as a key and strategic area in the field of business analytics
You will support in definition and execution of global business analytics strategy, help to position business analytics team as central point of contact for all data analytics questions and use cases
Will be under your responsibility the execution/ management of projects within the area of advanced business analytics closely aligned with business and senior management
Also, you will ensure the Coaching and Training of virtual teams and functional areas within the core disciplines of analytics
You will actively participate in the processes of digitization and automation of tasks, contributing to the company's evolution towards digital transformation


What Makes You Great


You have 5-7 years of experience in analytical insights and data science and hold a master‚Äôs degree in STEM from a prestigious university
Also, you have a natural ability to turn concepts into computational systems and transform business questions into data-driven insights
In addition, you have strong expertise in Finance, Sales, and Supply Chain processes
You are an expert in data modeling, feature engineering, and have strong knowledge of SQL, R, R Shiny, and Python
Furthermore, you have a solid understanding of data and system architectures and their role in digital transformation
You possess excellent English communication skills and can effectively engage with technical and business teams
Also, you have experience in Scrum and Agile methodologies to manage projects and drive high-performing teams
Additionally you are willing to travel when necessary to support business initiatives
You are ready to face new challenges and actively contribute to the success of the company's digital transformation project
You are able to collect, interpret and use data effectively, driving digital transformation


Why you will love working with us

At Linde we identify ourselves with our products ‚Äì either working for the technical or medical gases business. Being a company with a long tradition in the gases business, we not only care about our customers and high quality products, but most importantly about our employees. While working with us, expect a safe workplace, high safety standards and a true commitment from our managers to safety.

What we offer you!

At Linde, the sky is not the limit. If you‚Äôre looking to build a career where your work reaches beyond your job description and betters the people with whom you work, the communities we serve, and the world in which we all live, at Linde, your opportunities are limitless. Be Linde. Be Limitless.

This role is a full time position based on an unlimited contract. The standard weekly working hours will be from 08:00 hrs till 17:00 hrs.

Have we inspired you? Let¬¥s talk about it

We are looking forward to receiving your complete application (motivation letter, CV, certificates) via our online job market.

Any designations used of course apply to persons of all genders. The form of speech used here is for simplicity only.

Linde acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development.

  • Will be under your responsibility the execution/ management of projects within the area of advanced business analytics closely aligned with business and senior management
  • Also, you will ensure the Coaching and Training of virtual teams and functional areas within the core disciplines of analytics
  • You will actively participate in the processes of digitization and automation of tasks, contributing to the company's evolution towards digital transformation

What Makes You Great

  • You have 5-7 years of experience in analytical insights and data science and hold a master‚Äôs degree in STEM from a prestigious university
  • Also, you have a natural ability to turn concepts into computational systems and transform business questions into data-driven insights
  • In addition, you have strong expertise in Finance, Sales, and Supply Chain processes
  • You are an expert in data modeling, feature engineering, and have strong knowledge of SQL, R, R Shiny, and Python
  • Furthermore, you have a solid understanding of data and system architectures and their role in digital transformation
  • You possess excellent English communication skills and can effectively engage with technical and business teams
  • Also, you have experience in Scrum and Agile methodologies to manage projects and drive high-performing teams
  • Additionally you are willing to travel when necessary to support business initiatives
  • You are ready to face new challenges and actively contribute to the success of the company's digital transformation project
  • You are able to collect, interpret and use data effectively, driving digital transformation

Why you will love working with us

At Linde we identify ourselves with our products ‚Äì either working for the technical or medical gases business. Being a company with a long tradition in the gases business, we not only care about our customers and high quality products, but most importantly about our employees. While working with us, expect a safe workplace, high safety standards and a true commitment from our managers to safety.

What we offer you!

At Linde, the sky is not the limit. If you‚Äôre looking to build a career where your work reaches beyond your job description and betters the people with whom you work, the communities we serve, and the world in which we all live, at Linde, your opportunities are limitless. Be Linde. Be Limitless.

This role is a full time position based on an unlimited contract. The standard weekly working hours will be from 08:00 hrs till 17:00 hrs.

Have we inspired you? Let¬¥s talk about it

We are looking forward to receiving your complete application (motivation letter, CV, certificates) via our online job market.

Any designations used of course apply to persons of all genders. The form of speech used here is for simplicity only.

Linde acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development.

Title: Data Science Associate
Description:
Who We Are

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What you will do


Support data-driven decision-making by preparing and analyzing data related to customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales across multiple channels.
Work closely with data scientists and business stakeholders to translate business questions into meaningful insights.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support data science model development.
Use Python and SQL to clean, process, and visualize data in support of analytics and modeling projects.
Apply basic statistical methods (e.g. descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, hypothesis testing) to uncover insights.
Ensure data quality and consistency across sources by collaborating with data engineering and IT teams.
Communicate findings clearly through presentations and storytelling.
Actively participate in sprint planning, reviews, and agile ceremonies within the team.



What you‚Äôll bring


3+ years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or a related data role.
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or Engineering.
Experience working with data using SQL and Python (pandas, matplotlib/seaborn).
Experience with PySpark and Spark technologies is a strong plus, but not mandatory.
Basic understanding of statistics and its application in business analytics.
Strong attention to detail, curiosity, and eagerness to learn.
Good communication skills, including the ability to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Team player with a proactive mindset and willingness to grow in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English (written and spoken)



Nice to have:


Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or Databricks.
Knowledge of Python packages used in machine learning (e.g. scikit-learn).



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Principal Machine Learning Engineer - MLOps
Description:
We are looking for a Principal Machine Learning Engineer focused on ML Ops and ML Platform development. This engineer will join a centralised Machine Learning Engineering team, supporting scalable AI systems across Digital and Retail use cases.

The ideal candidates will bring hands-on expertise in MLOps, distributed Machine Learning platforms, and experience working in cloud-native environments, especially Azure

Requirements


8+ years of relevant experience in Machine Learning, Data Engineering, or MLOps roles.
Proven track record of building, deploying, and maintaining ML systems in production environments.
Proficient with ML frameworks: PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Scikit-learn
Hands-on experience with MLflow, SageMaker, and Azure ML for model training, tracking, and deployment
Skilled in CI/CD pipelines for ML using GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps, and Terraform
Expertise in model observability, monitoring and drift detection
Experience building and managing ML pipelines using Airflow, Azure Data Factory, and related tools
Cloud infrastructure expertise with Azure (primary) and AWS (secondary).
Containerization and orchestration using Docker and Kubernetes (AKS).


Benefits

The Things We Really Care About:


Health Insurance, because health comes first
Flexible working hours
Open holidays, take the time you need for yourself
Profit distribution for everyone
Mindera Annual Trip, Sports, and sharing groups to connect and have fun!
Training & conferences, create your own training plan
Child Care vouchers


Other good things:


Choose Laptop & Peripherals that best suit your needs
Hotspot with unlimited usage (PT), for work or Netflix ;)
We have amazing offices in Porto, Aveiro, and Coimbra if you want to physically connect with minders. Remote from Portugal is also an option. Remote from other Countries will depend on your current location and Projects
At the offices, we have a wide range of snacks to keep you fed and healthy
Partnerships with local businesses


Most of all you get to work with a bunch of great people, where the whole team owns the project together in a politics-free environment. Our culture reflects our lean and self-organization attitude. We encourage our colleagues to take risks, make decisions, work in a collaborative way and talk to everyone to enhance communication. Freedom and Responsibility go hand in hand, and we value commitment, feedback, and empathy.

About Mindera

At Mindera we use technology to build products we are proud of, with people we love.

Software Engineering Applications, including Web and Mobile, are at the core of what we do at Mindera.

We partner with our clients, to understand their products and deliver high-performance, resilient, and scalable software systems that create an impact on their users and businesses across the world.

You get to work with a bunch of great people, where the whole team owns the project together.

Our culture reflects our lean and self-management attitude. We encourage our colleagues to take risks, make decisions, work in a collaborative way and talk to everyone to enhance communication.

We are proud of our work and we love to learn all and everything while navigating through an Agile, Lean and collaborative environment.

Check out our Blog and our Handbook!

Our offices are located: Porto, Portugal | Aveiro, Portugal | Coimbra, Portugal | Leicester, UK | San Diego, USA | San Francisco, USA | Chennai, India | Bengaluru, India | Cluj-Napoca, Romania | Blumenau, Brazil

Title: Quality Assurance Scientist
HTML:
Job Title: Quality Assurance Scientist

Job Ref: AICOS_Jobs_2025_24

Job Type: Full-time contract.

Job Salary: The range is between ‚Ç¨1,751.27 and ‚Ç¨1,834.93, depending on the candidate's professional experience (1 year or more).

Job Location: Porto, Portugal.

Job Description

Fraunhofer Portugal AICOS is seeking a talented Quality Assurance Scientist to join our dynamic and multidisciplinary team within the Connected Things (Cyber-physical systems) Group, namely in Quality Assurance and Regulatory Affairs. It is expected that the candidate will contribute to the business area of Digital Health.

Your Role

  • Document and maintain software requirements;
  • Document, execute and maintain test cases based on requirements;
  • Develop and maintain UI tests;
  • Set up and maintain CI/CD pipelines.

Your Profile

  • Mandatory Requirements:
    • Academic Qualifications: Master's degree or equivalent academic qualification in Informatics, Bioengineering, and Computing Engineering or similar;
    • Professional Experience: Preferably 1 year of professional experience in the field.
  • Technical Skills:
    • Candidates should have experience in software engineering and testing. Experience in developing automated tests for mobile or web applications is highly regarded. The candidate will work in close contact with software development, so experience within this field will be highly valued.
  • Other Skills:
    • Excellent English communication skills (technical and general audiences);
    • Capacity to translate research findings into actionable insights for real-world applications.
We Value

  • Experience with test case management tools, such as TestRail or similar;
  • Experience with CI/CD tools, such as Jenkins or similar;
  • Candidates experienced in automating tests of Flutter and/or Java (Spring Boot) applications using mocking tools such as Mockito or similar is highly valued;
  • Experience with Quality Management System maintenance or auditing, according to standards such as ISO 13485:2016 or ISO 9001:2015, is valued.

Why Should You Join Fraunhofer Portugal

  • Innovative Environment: Be part of a people-centric workplace that fosters creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. We encourage the development of new ideas and ensure that every voice is heard;
  • Research with Impact: Engage in projects that sit at the intersection of research and real-world applications, contributing to technology that makes a tangible difference in society;
  • Multidisciplinary Teams: Collaborate with professionals from diverse backgrounds, enhancing your learning and professional growth;
  • Professional Excellence: Work within a culture that upholds professional standards and best practices, promoting continuous improvement and excellence in research;
  • Flexible Work Arrangements: Benefit from flexible working hours and hybrid work opportunities, supporting a healthy work-life balance;
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Benefit from a partially funded health insurance plan, and a variety of additional perks;
  • Supportive Culture: Join a team with an excellent spirit, where collaboration, mutual support, and team achievements are celebrated.

Application Process

Applications are open from the 5th to the 20th of August 2025.

The selected candidate is expected to start working on October 1st, 2025.

Applications Must Be Made To The Email And Contain

  • Curriculum Vitae ‚Äì mandatory;
  • Motivation Letter ‚Äì optional;
  • Recommendation Letters ‚Äì optional.

Selection Process

Admitted candidates will be subject to a curricular evaluation. Based on the results, the top-ranked candidates will be invited for an interview. All applicants will be notified of the results of the call via the email address provided in their application.

After notification, all candidates have 10 days to comment.

Note

The research activities in the scope of this job opportunity are planned to be developed within the framework of the following projects:

  • ATE ‚Äì Alian√ßa para a Transi√ß√£o Energ√©tica, with Notice No. 01/C05-i01/2021 and Project Reference No. 56 NextGenerationEU (PRR);
  • ConnectedHealth ‚Äì Smart and End-to-end Healthcare Management Platform, with Notice No. 26/SI/2016 and Project Reference No. POCI-01-0247-FEDER-046858;
  • HfPT ‚Äì Health from Portugal, with Notice No. 02/C05-i01/2022 and Project Reference No. 41 NextGenerationEU (PRR);
  • Microelectr√≥nica ‚Äì Agenda Microeletr√≥nica, with Notice No. 01/C05-i01/2021 and Project Reference No. 19 NextGenerationEU (PRR);
  • SmILE ‚Äì Smart Implants for Life Enrichment, with Notice No. HORIZON-HLTH-2023-STAYHLTH-01-01 and Project Reference No. 101136376 Horizon Europe Framework Programme.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
TUI Group is the world‚Äôs number one integrated tourism business.

The Customer AI & Rapid Prototyping department stands at the forefront of digital transformation at TUI, driving company-wide AI adoption. Our team develops innovative AI solutions and personalized customer experiences that create measurable business value and give TUI a competitive edge in the travel industry. We combine data science, AI prototyping, and strategic implementation to deliver both rapid innovation and sustainable personalization solutions. In our dynamic work environment, we foster a culture of experimentation and data-driven decision-making, while working closely with various business units to shape the future of personalized travel experiences.

We are looking for a talented and dedicated Machine Learning Engineer to help leverage AI and advanced analytics to better understand our customers, deliver personalized experiences, and drive business growth through data-driven decision-making

Become part of our team - applications open! This role will be advertised for a minimum of 14 days but could close anytime after this time so don't delay!

About Our Offer


Personal benefits: Attractive remuneration, bonus opportunity, exclusive travel perks & discounts, extensive health & wellbeing support, and more.
Flexible working: Work is something you do, not somewhere you go. We encourage a healthy work-life balance and offer hybrid or remote working models.
A career to shape: Opportunities to upskill, reskill and grow your career. Access the TUI Tech Learning Hub to level-up and reach your ambitions.
Expand your horizons: Participate in our tech communities and collaborate on global projects and teams.
Community: Get involved with incredible local charity and sustainability initiatives like the TUI Care Foundation and the Sustainable Tech Community.



About The Job


As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be part of a cross-functional team that enables AI engineering skills and capabilities across TUI Group, aligning with TUI‚Äôs AI strategy. Being an AI enthusiast with a strong DevSecOps mindset, you‚Äôll collaborate with your team to deliver solutions that challenge the status quo, taking full responsibility for your AI solutions from design to operation. You diligently care about the quality of your work, including proper documentation and security aspects.
You will collaborate closely with our App, Web, and CRM teams to leverage AI and advanced analytics to better understand customer behavior, deliver personalized experiences, and support business growth. You‚Äôll build and maintain segmentation models that enable tailored offers and informed decision-making. Your work will contribute to seamless, engaging customer interactions that drive satisfaction and bookings, ensuring customers feel understood and valued.
You can articulate your thoughts and ideas and take the initiative to translate them into outcomes, ensuring alignment with business and technical teams together with the domain‚Äôs teams and the Group Enabler teams, you will research, evaluate, and test new approaches, processes, and tools, helping teams use them effectively. You will participate in Communities of Practice and collaborate on shared initiatives to grow your experience. You are eager to learn and grow in your role, welcoming support and coaching from senior colleagues.
You thrive in an international, multi-cultural team, constructively challenging and holding high expectations for yourself and others.
You consistently drive for technical excellence, ownership, and self-organization at both team and personal levels. You are passionate about learning, acquiring new skills, and staying up-to-date with the latest developments in your focus areas.
Security is part of everyone‚Äôs job. At TUI, we practise secure behaviours first in everything we do.



About You


Experience in designing, implementing, deploying and using various AI models and algorithms.
Experience in deploying AI solutions (e.g. CI/CD pipeline, API development, containers).
Strong programming skills in Python.
Understanding of machine learning/AI frameworks and libraries.
Hands-on experience with cloud technologies and services (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Experience with SQL and/or Snowflake.
Some experience with Generative AI technologies (e.g. Bedrock, Langchain, LangGraph).
Familiarity with RAG and Graphs.
Proficiency in data preprocessing and feature and/or prompt engineering.
Customer-focused engineer with a passion for crafting high-quality digital products, continuous improvement, and effective team collaboration.
Strong problem-solving and communication skills, with an understanding of the social, legal, and ethical impact of AI technologies.



From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.

We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments so if you require any support, please do let us know.

  • Flexible working: Work is something you do, not somewhere you go. We encourage a healthy work-life balance and offer hybrid or remote working models.
  • A career to shape: Opportunities to upskill, reskill and grow your career. Access the TUI Tech Learning Hub to level-up and reach your ambitions.
  • Expand your horizons: Participate in our tech communities and collaborate on global projects and teams.
  • Community: Get involved with incredible local charity and sustainability initiatives like the TUI Care Foundation and the Sustainable Tech Community.


About The Job

  • As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be part of a cross-functional team that enables AI engineering skills and capabilities across TUI Group, aligning with TUI‚Äôs AI strategy. Being an AI enthusiast with a strong DevSecOps mindset, you‚Äôll collaborate with your team to deliver solutions that challenge the status quo, taking full responsibility for your AI solutions from design to operation. You diligently care about the quality of your work, including proper documentation and security aspects.
  • You will collaborate closely with our App, Web, and CRM teams to leverage AI and advanced analytics to better understand customer behavior, deliver personalized experiences, and support business growth. You‚Äôll build and maintain segmentation models that enable tailored offers and informed decision-making. Your work will contribute to seamless, engaging customer interactions that drive satisfaction and bookings, ensuring customers feel understood and valued.
  • You can articulate your thoughts and ideas and take the initiative to translate them into outcomes, ensuring alignment with business and technical teams together with the domain‚Äôs teams and the Group Enabler teams, you will research, evaluate, and test new approaches, processes, and tools, helping teams use them effectively. You will participate in Communities of Practice and collaborate on shared initiatives to grow your experience. You are eager to learn and grow in your role, welcoming support and coaching from senior colleagues.
  • You thrive in an international, multi-cultural team, constructively challenging and holding high expectations for yourself and others.
  • You consistently drive for technical excellence, ownership, and self-organization at both team and personal levels. You are passionate about learning, acquiring new skills, and staying up-to-date with the latest developments in your focus areas.
  • Security is part of everyone‚Äôs job. At TUI, we practise secure behaviours first in everything we do.


About You

  • Experience in designing, implementing, deploying and using various AI models and algorithms.
  • Experience in deploying AI solutions (e.g. CI/CD pipeline, API development, containers).
  • Strong programming skills in Python.
  • Understanding of machine learning/AI frameworks and libraries.
  • Hands-on experience with cloud technologies and services (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
  • Experience with SQL and/or Snowflake.
  • Some experience with Generative AI technologies (e.g. Bedrock, Langchain, LangGraph).
  • Familiarity with RAG and Graphs.
  • Proficiency in data preprocessing and feature and/or prompt engineering.
  • Customer-focused engineer with a passion for crafting high-quality digital products, continuous improvement, and effective team collaboration.
  • Strong problem-solving and communication skills, with an understanding of the social, legal, and ethical impact of AI technologies.


From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.

We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments so if you require any support, please do let us know.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Your responsibilities




We‚Äôre looking for a Python Developer (F/M/D) with a passion for building robust back-end services to join our team and contribute to the development of our web-based product: the AI-powered CELUS Engineering Platform, which automates the electronics engineering process and significantly reduces development time. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Python development and a commitment to seamless user experiences. In this role you will:




Participate in the development of the back-end web applications and REST APIs, leveraging your existing web development experience.
Write efficient, readable, and maintainable Python code, embracing challenging tasks that extend beyond conventional Python API development.
Interact with a wide variety of tasks, from building APIs to coming up with clever business logic.
Interface and team up with other areas of engineering to solve diverse back-end problems, from third-party integrations to data modelling.




Your profile




3+ years of Python experience, including familiarity with Python web frameworks, preferably FastAPI, pydantic
Competence in using pytest and linters to ensure code quality
Knowledge of ORM on python and databases, MongoDB and SQL preferred
Ability to write highly legible code, using design patterns and generally accepted best practices
Knowledge of micro-service architecture is highly advantageous but not essential
Fluent in written and spoken English
Agile-mindset and solution driven way of thinking
Fluent in written and spoken English




We offer:

Shape the future

Have a direct impact on the electronics industry with our agile and international team.




Feel welcome

Enjoy our startup atmosphere and get to know the CELUS team at regular team events and our annual company offsite.




Lunch on us

Enjoy meal allowance, with a Coverflex card, which can be used in restaurants, supermarkets, food delivery services within the VISA network.




Stay healthy

Benefit from Private Health Insurance through the leading health insurance brand in Portugal, ensuring peace of mind for your well-being.




Learn and develop

Improve your skills with our learning platforms, English/Portuguese language classes, trainings and workshops.




Decide where and when you work

Enjoy hybrid office environment with home office allowance, flexible working schedule, ‚Äúworkation‚Äù program, 24 vacation days plus additional paid Christmas week holiday.




ABOUT US

CELUS simplifies and accelerates the electronics design process for the global engineering community with it‚Äôs AI-powered CELUS Design Platform.




We are a Munich founded start-up on a mission to unleash scalable engineering by providing a comprehensive library of electronics components and CUBOs, automating all the manual and tedious tasks in the design process, so engineers can spend more time on innovation.




Join our community of tech enthusiasts and proactive high performers in an amazing journey through the world of electronics. We work with a clear vision, empowered by an ambitious, fast-paced environment and caring atmosphere, where your ideas and contributions are highly valued. We have offices in Munich, Germany; and Porto, Portugal; and Austin, Texas, USA.




Embracing diversity is a very important value at CELUS. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression.
